meanings.definition: A framework consisting of a horizontal beam supported by two pairs of sloping legs, used to support a bridge or platform.
meanings.sent1: The workers built a sturdy trestle to hold up the new bridge.
meanings.sent2: The old railway bridge had a wooden trestle that provided strong support.
meanings.sent3: The trestle creaked under the weight of the marching band, adding a musical touch to the parade.
meanings.sent4: Her friendship acted as a trestle, supporting me through difficult times.
meanings.sent5: The trestle stood tall against the backdrop of the setting sun, a symbol of strength and reliability.

meanings.definition: A supporting structure made of a horizontal beam supported by two pairs of sloping legs.
meanings.sent1: The carpenters constructed a trestle to elevate the platform for the event.
meanings.sent2: The garden shed had a small trestle to keep the tools organized.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat used the trestle as a hiding spot during the game of hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: His words acted as a trestle, lifting her spirits during the challenging times.
meanings.sent5: The trestle blended seamlessly with the natural surroundings, providing both support and aesthetic appeal.
